title: Asparagus and Prosciutto Rolls
introduction: Thinly sliced prosciutto wrapped around asparagus spears creates a visually appealing and delicious appetizer. This versatile dish can be easily modified by substituting the prosciutto with smoked salmon or salami, or by using breadsticks instead of asparagus.
ingredients: 1/4 pound thinly sliced imported Italian prosciutto

instructions.description: Snap or cut off the base of the asparagus where the color changes from green to white. In a large skillet, bring about 2 inches of water to a boil. Add salt to taste. Add the asparagus. Cook until an asparagus spear bends gently when lifted by the stem end, about 4 to 8 minutes, depending on the thickness of the asparagus. They should be tender yet crisp. Drain the asparagus and cool under running water. Blot dry.
Cut the prosciutto slices in half crosswise. Leaving the tips uncovered, wind a piece of prosciutto around the length of each asparagus spear. Arrange the asparagus on a serving platter.
Serve immediately or cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate up to 3 hours.

variations: Substitute smoked salmon or salami for the prosciutto.
